dynmethods 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Adding a new TI method

    dynmethods

    This package contains wrappers for all of the trajectory inference methods included in the dynverse review. These wrappers contain code to translate the data structures produced by any of the methods to the common trajectory model (Fig. 1b in manuscript). There are several common post-processing functions provided by the dynwrap package (Supp. Fig. 19b in manuscript), which the different wrappers are allowed to make use of.

    Currently implemented are the following wrappers:

    Name Code Vignette
    Angle R/ti_angle.R#L11
    Control: error R/ti_error.R#L10
    Control: identity R/ti_identity.R#L10
    Control: random R/ti_random.R#L10
    Control: shuffle R/ti_shuffle.R#L12
    DPT R/ti_dpt.R#L25
    Embeddr R/ti_embeddr.R#L14
    GPfates R/ti_gpfates.R#L14
    Growing Neural Gas R/ti_gng.R#L13
    MATCHER R/ti_matcher.R#L11
    MERLoT R/ti_merlot.R#L15
    mfa R/ti_mfa.R#L12
    Mpath R/ti_mpath.R#L11
    ouija R/ti_ouija.R#L13
    ouijaflow R/ti_ouijaflow.R#L10
    PAGA R/ti_paga.R#L43
    Periodic PrinCurve R/ti_periodpc.R#L13
    PhenoPath R/ti_phenopath.R#L13
    pseudogp R/ti_pseudogp.R#L14
